entry.title: Reland^2 "Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit c37505129ee027a86b3416141230a27516fba43b,

which was reverted because of unit test failures in CI. These failures

did actually happen in CQ but were hidden there because later reruns

of the tests in isolation passed.



The only change is the weakening of a CHECK in

chromeos/startup/browser_init_params.cc that is necessary as long

as ViewTestsBase is used by both unit (crosapi disabled) and non-unit

(crosapi enabled) tests.



Original change's description:

> Reland "Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust"

>

> This is a reland of commit e5f6f1434e631cd1c8154a41ee95ce6126688e9a.

> The only difference is: disabling a test that conflicts with

> the new implementation (see b/323984075).

>

> Original change's description:

> > Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust

> >

> > See chromium:1508245 for context.

> >

> > - Decide whether crosapi is enabled based on the command line

> > switches. In particular, make it independent of when/whether

> > BrowserTestBase::SetUp gets called.

> > We still provide DisableCrosapiForTesting for legacy reasons,

> > as some tests need to ovrerride it.

> >

> > - This, plus some new checks, make it hard for tests

> > * to accidentally and silently override the Ash-provided init

> > params with mostly empty ones, or

> > * to accidentally and silently prevent the Ash-provided params

> > from even being read.

> >

> > - Address a TODO in InProcessBrowserTest thanks to these changes.

> >

> > - Call DisableCrosapiForTesting in ViewsTestBase-derived tests that

> > run with crosapi enabled but are not prepared to set it up (and thus

> > would fail one of the new checks) and in fact don't need crosapi.

> >

> > - Remove InProcessBrowserTest::IsCrosapiEnabled() in favor of

> > !chromeos::BrowserParamsProxy::IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting(). There

> > is no need to have the InProcessBrowserTest predicate and it's not

> > an InProcessBrowserTest level concept.

> >

> > - Remove ScopedDisableCrosapiForTesting class, as there is no need for

> > a scope. Tests should either not call DisableCrosapiForTesting at

> > all or should do it very early on (CHECK'd). Undoing it is not

> > supported and it's not neceesary because tests run in separate

> > processes.

> >

> > - Add documentation to startup/README.md.

> >

> > - Remove some uses of IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting from production code

> > that are no longer needed.

> >

> > Bug: chromium:1508245

> > Change-Id: Id6b68a25dae4c50132f957f4b80879fdcde2e7b2

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5076190

> > Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

> > Reviewed-by: Hidehiko Abe

> > Commit-Queue: Georg Neis

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1255430}

>

> Bug: chromium:1508245, b/323984075

> Change-Id: I8cced0fe121b3edb757aacc07a706205566cbf24

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5267259

entry.title: snap-group: Don't start SVOVS if the to-be-snapped window is the only one
entry.content:
This cl addresses the P1 request to not show SVOVS if the

to-be-snapped window is the only window on the active desk and display

by adding another pre-check condition before starting SVOVS.



This cl fixed a bunch of unit tests that are based on the previous

assumptions.



This cl also adds logic to end SVOVS on tablet mode started, which

is used to work due to the previous assumption protection. But

with the hiding of virtual desk bar and saved desks button, we need

to reflect the correct UI element for the corresponding SOVOS setup

types.



Fixed: b/324479915

Demo: http://b/324479915#comment2

Test: Added new + fixed existing + manual

Change-Id: I6ae6344bdddfbffd8df0d236079f291917b26db9

entry.title: Invalidate FrameSelection's visual selection cache when scroll occurs.
entry.content:
RenderWidgetHostViewAura::GetCaretBounds currently returns outdated

caret bounds if a scroll occurred after placing the caret.



This seems due to blink::FrameSelection having an outdated cache of

visual selection information, since this cache is currently only

invalidated on layout tree update:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/dom/document.cc;l=2130;drc=1b5fb86a995bf16dfe1156b4953605484f430280



Since scrolling also affects visual selection information, add a call to

invalidate visual selection information on scroll too.



Bug: b:316261402

Change-Id: I84931a671bda61467ad77b6b2b181a3a0f9bfb1b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5274560

entry.title: Audio: Map rear surround channel to surround channel if necessary
entry.content:
Most of the configurable audio channel layout in Audio MIDI uses

Side Left (Ls) and Side Right (Rs) as the default surround channel,

while some of the WAV/FLAC/AAC audios uses Back Left (Rls) and Back

Right (Rrs) as default surround channel.



If we unconditionally treat Rls and Rrs as it is, and if Audio MIDI

device has no Rls and Rrs channels (only `7.1 Surround` and `7.1.4`

configuration has Rls & Rrs channel for now), then these two channels

will be silent.



QuickTime is doing something correct, so we can do something similar

here, the overall logic will be:



1. If Audio has no Rls & Rrs channels -> Do nothing.

2. If Audio has Rls & Rrs channels, and has Ls & Rs channels ->

Do nothing.

3. If Audio has Rls & Rrs channels, and has no Ls & Rs channels,

device has Rls & Rrs channels -> Do nothing.

4. If Audio has Rls & Rrs channels, and has no Ls & Rs channels,

device has no Rls & Rrs channels -> Map Rls to Ls, Rrs to Rs.



Bug: 40809490

Bug: 41495709

Bug: 41487675



Change-Id: Ida7250a0d4f41f2f7045affea6ac85efd853f4d1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5281737

entry.title: Audio: Continue correct channel layout order mapping
entry.content:
Chromium currently is using the same channel layout that matched with

FFMPEG. For `FFMpegAudioDecoder`, it will ensure the decoded output

comes with correct channel layout and order described in:



https://trac.ffmpeg.org/wiki/AudioChannelManipulation#Listchannelnamesandstandardchannellayouts.



The root cause of the 7.1 mapping issue is that Chromium and FFMPEG

uses the same layout, but in different orders. FFMPEG decoder will

ensure the output channel data ordered in `AV_CHANNEL_ORDER_NATIVE`

which doesn't map correctly with orders in Chromium.



"The native channel order, i.e. the channels are in the same order

in which they are defined in the AVChannel enum" is the defination of

`AV_CHANNEL_ORDER_NATIVE`, `AVChannel` is currently equivalent to

`media::Channels` in Chromium, so the fix is simple, just make

sure channel are in "native" order and matched with FFMPEG.



The problem can't be reproduced if decoder is `AudioToolboxAudioDecoder`

and if audio is in 7.1 setup, since we do audio channel remapping by

ourselves for that decoder.



I've also noticed that some of the channel layout for Windows doesn't

matched correctly with the definition in `ksmedia.h`, and some

layout are missed in `mf_helper.cc` and `core_audio_util_win.cc`,

so let's just fill the unfinished part in this CL too...



Bug: 40809490

Bug: 41495709

Change-Id: Ie328500341ef2230ef1eda0b5757d5aa94040d99

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5264039

entry.title: VpxVideoEncoder: Clean up Flush() and DrainOutputs()
entry.content:
media::VpxVideoEncoder runs the libvpx encoder synchronously.

Therefore its Encode() outputs the encoded data during its call.

Flush() doesn't need to perform libvpx flush operation. This CL

removes the libvpx flush operation in Flush().

This CL refactors DrainOutputs() so that it returns VideoEncoderOutput

and becomes a constant function. The function is renamed to

GetEncoderOutput().



BUG=b:280363228

TEST=media_unittests

entry.title: Remove rsesek@chromium.org from chrome/browser/notifications/mac/OWNERS
entry.content:
This suggested change is automatically generated based on group

memberships and affiliations.

If this change is unnecessary or in error, vote CR -1 and the bot

entry.title: [omnibox] Correctly report zero_prefix_enabled in Autocomplete session.
entry.content:
Currently zero_prefix_enabled is reported as true if

num_zero_prefix_suggestions_shown is greater than 0. However, what

this metric should really report is whether the zero-suggest was

enabled in the session - user could've seen zero-prefix suggestions.

`AutocompleteInput::IsZeroSuggest()` should be a good enough proxy for

whether or not zero-suggest was enabled in the session, despite other

eligibility criteria.

entry.title: extensions: Add a kill switch for Controlled Frame
entry.content:
Originally added in

https://crrev.com/f29be250daa934cfd82bdf8ba716af9c793c336d, the

Controlled Frame feature flag was removed in

https://crrev.com/55561224591a01280ac3e8d6a23e58b5aadceb28. The reason

for the removal was to allow ChromeOS MGS to get access to Controlled

Frame where the configuration cannot supply or check feature flags.

Instead, Controlled Frame availability is gated now by

AreIsolatedWebAppsEnabled().



In addition to the normal isolated app / kiosk checks, we want to add a

feature flag back that's default-enabled so in case we need it there's a

kill switch present. This change adds that flag back and makes

Controlled Frame's availability contingent on that feature flag being

enabled. Note that this flag being enabled does not enable Controlled

Frame for pages, it just allows the availability checks to run. If the

flag is disabled, either via command-line or Finch, then Controlled

Frame will be disabled.



Bug: 1233993, b/322890807

Change-Id: Ibb1706947023f3c8eb8371ec829bd7e9d304692d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5283947

entry.title: Add locks to Dawn service serializer
entry.content:
logging and uncaptured error callbacks may happen spontaneously,

even on another thread. Dawn already ensures that there are no races

between multiple calls to GetCmdSpace, but we also need to ensure

getting command space does not race with Flush.

entry.title: [ SavedTabGroup ] URL fragments no longer reload tabs across devices
entry.content:
This CL prevents tabs on other devices from reloading / reacting to

fragment changes received from the device being used. In some instances

it would reset the state of the web page which was the source of the

frustration.



For example, in google docs, users with the group open on multiple

devices would see their cursor jump around the webpage, and even go back

to the top of the screen as they were typing / moving over headings

which updated the url fragment.



Change-Id: I543fb4b5910a6b01c4f9fb49ee5cd8598d5fecf2

entry.title: Set no parent for blink/extensions changes.
entry.content:
This allows us to enforce the policy outlined here:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/extensions/README.md



Also changes the owners to the API owners, for these reasons:

* Blink extensions are only appropriate in special "non-web-exposed" situations, and this kind of decision is appropriate for the API owners to make.

* set noparent is only allowed for coherent groups identified in build/OWNERS.setnoparent, and not using API owners would require us to set up an entirely new concept with no other reason to exist. Instead we can re-use the API owners concept and the additional overhead is relatively small.

entry.title: [HitTestOpaqueness] Record hit test data for scrolling backgrounds
entry.content:
This doesn't help much to HitTestOpaqueness itself because the visible

area of scrolling contents is also covered by the ScrollHitTestData of

the scroller which ensures opaqueness to hit test if the scroller is

opaque to hit test.



The actual benefits are:

- This may improve scroll performance for scrolling contents that

don't have a background. The new hit test data will make most

scrolling contents layers to be always the same size as the

scroll overflow regardless of the cull rect (which may change on

scroll), to avoid full layer rerasterization when the cull rect

change affects the bounds of the painted scrolling contents.

- This may help crbug.com/324285520 because the new hit test data

carries special hit test data.

- This also prepares for a CL for UseRecordedBoundsForTiling to

prevent extra rasterization (caused by change of the origin of the

tiling rect) during scroll.



Bug: 40062957

entry.title: Revert "Reland "[ios][TipSNotifications] Update DefaultBrowser notification""
entry.content:
This reverts commit df638c279b5fa6a374cab7659dd3fe8f49ba1d4e.



Reason for revert: TipsNotificationsTestCase/testTriggerNotifications is failing: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/ios-simulator-noncq/41487/overview



Original change's description:

> Reland "[ios][TipSNotifications] Update DefaultBrowser notification"

>

> This is a reland of commit 379544d3eaebce17717fcb7b9d3c7339cba65bf7

>

> The reason for the revert was that the eg test failed sometimes. It seems to have failed waiting for the notification to appear. However,

> based on the screenshot at failure the app was never brought back into

> the foreground which would have triggered the notification. As far as

> I can tell, what happened was that when the app is "deactivated" by

> simulating a home button press the test needs to wait until it is

> fully deactivated before calling XCUIApplication activate - otherwise

> activate will return immediately since the app is still active and later

> the app will go into the background.

>

> Original change's description:

> > [ios][TipSNotifications] Update DefaultBrowser notification

> >

> > This change updates the Default Browser Tips notification to lead to the

> > Default Browser settings screen (as recently discussed in the design

> > doc).

> >

> > It also adds EG tests to verify the flow when the user interacts

> > with any of the Tips notifications.

> >

> > Fixed: 323943933

> > Change-Id: Idd8eb03d430ea697d97649e01e9126e4dd70509c

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273024

entry.title: [iOS] Add post-default browser abandonment promo
entry.content:
Adds logic to show a system alert when Chrome was likely the default browser recently, but no longer appears to be. This alert is disabled

by default.



The interval used to determine whether Chrome was recently the default

browser is defined via 2 Finch parameters for the start and end. They

are both expressed as an integer representing a time span, in days,

going backwards in time. The comment above the parameter declarations

goes into more details.



When this features is enabled, the default browser scene agent will

verify eligibility on each app foreground, and if the conditions are

met, the promo will be registered for display with the Promo Manager.

This promo obeys the global cooldown and the default browser promo

shared cooldown, so impression might be delayed for a few days in some

scenarios. It has an impression limit of one ever. The prompt takes

precedence over all other Promo Manager promos except the two post-

restore system alerts.

entry.title: Simple fix for crbug.com/41497250
entry.content:
crrev.com/1226388 didn't put all changes behind the

DynamicScrollRectExpansion feature. The 4 lines of added code not

behind the flag caused the bug. This CL moves the code to be under

DynamicScrollRectExpansion. The bug under the feature will be fixed

later.



The 4 lines of code caused problem of ChangedEnough() if the input

cull rect is clipped by ancestors to be smaller than the scrolling

contents and the scroller is not scrollable in one direction.

Subsequent change of the ancestor clip missed update because

ChangedEnough() mistakenly treated the change as not changed enough

as the changed edge didn't touch any edge of the scrolling contents

rect.

entry.title: wayland: dnd: implement data fetching cancellation
entry.content:
Implement a best-effort cancellation logic for data fetching tasks in

incoming dnd sessions.



- Data fetching tasks run in the thead pool;

- Scoped refs for base::AtomicFlags are used for each posted task;

- It's quite unlikely (though not impossible) to have more than one

active fetching task at a given time;

- With this change, data fetching tasks are cancelled upon drag leaves

as well as when the entered window get destroyed while data is being

fetched;

- Only the CancelFlag for the current data offer is held as

WaylandDataDragController::data_fetch_cancel_flag_;

- Cancel flag is checked before starting the data fetching for a new

mime type;

- That's why scoped_refptr is used to keep the flags alive until its

corresponding tasks quits, even when that's the only active ref for

it, ie: drag controller is tracking another task already;



R=sky

entry.title: [Compose] Fix request duration metrics
entry.content:
Before this CL a bug meant that the split Request duration metrics

were reported to:

`Compose.{EvalLocation}.Duration.{FinalStatus}`

and not:

`Compose.{EvalLocation}.Response.Duration.{FinalStatus}`



In addition before the histograms were split on EvalLocation they were

renamed to:

`Compose.Request.Duration.{FinalStatus}`



This rename was lost during a rebase when the histograms were split.



The rename made M122[1] but the split did not[2].



This CL corrects all the histograms on M123. There will only be 2

weeks of canary data for which the split histogram data was lost.





[1] https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/5e7d6d7d2556f8d7c6b9c441d3579da79dd7a8ee

[2] https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/80edd25c64489a2e98bf0a3dbc52f9b2ec8d7212



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.Response.Duration.Ok]=Replaced by Compose.Request.Duration.Ok

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.Response.Duration.Error]=Replaced by Compose.Request.Duration.Error

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.OnDevice.Response.Duration.Error]=Replaced by Compose.OnDevice.Request.Duration.Error

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.OnDevice.Response.Duration.Ok]=Replaced by Compose.OnDevice.Request.Duration.Ok

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.Server.Response.Duration.Ok]=Replaced by Compose.Server.Request.Duration.Ok

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Compose.Server.Response.Duration.Error]=Replaced by Compose.Server.Request.Duration.Error



Bug: b:324619808

entry.title: [ios] Create MagicStackRankingModel
entry.content:
MagicStackRankingModel is responsible for managing the MagicStack

module ranking. In its final state, it will also aggregate the module

configs from all the module mediators into one ranked list. For now

while MagicStack is not yet a UICollectionView, it will just mirror how

the consumer calls are made by the ContentSuggestionsMediator.



All the module mediators are moved to be owned by

ContentSuggestionsCoordinator and are passed into MagicStackRankingModel

through the initialized. ContentSuggestionsMediator will just be

responsible for the non-Magic Stack SetUpList, MVT, and Shortcut

logic.

entry.title: [shared storage] Introduce WorkletOptions param
entry.content:
Introduce WorkletOptions param for both addModule() and

createWorklet(). For the resource request, use the provided

credentials and use the SiteForCookies derived from the RFHI. This

aligns with the worklet standard [1], and aligns with the

implementation for other workers (e.g. for dedicated workers [2]).



Note that the new param for addModule() isn't gated by

kSharedStorageAPIM123. This is intentional: we have been deviating

from the worklet standard, so we consider this change as a bugfix.



[1] https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/worklets.html#dom-worklet-addmodule

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/dedicated_worker_host.cc?q=WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateAndStart

entry.title: ProtectedAudience: fix bugs with FledgeStoreBandAKeysInDB
entry.content:
Fix two bugs with the FledgeStoreBandAKeysInDB feature:

1) Change the protobuf type of "key" to bytes from string, which requires the value to be UTF-8 encoded. This change should be safe because 1) this table has not been used yet, since the feature hasn't been turned on and 2) type bytes should be compatible with values previously written as string.

2) Pass url loaders into BiddingAndAuctionServerKeyFetcher as scoped_refptr instead of raw pointers to prevent use-after-free. This is important for enabling FledgeStoreBandAKeysInDB because the new feature makes asynchronous calls to the database before using the loader.



Also, enable fieldtrial testing for this feature, FledgeStoreBandAKeysInDB.

entry.title: Don't refcount WebViewImpl.
entry.content:
In the distant past, this may have been needed, but there is no longer

any code outside WebViewImpl that holds a strong reference to

WebViewImpl. Just make it a regular heap allocated object, though still

behind the `Create()` and `Close()` facade. In the future, WebViewImpl

may migrate to the Oilpan heap using `SelfKeepAlive`.

entry.title: lacros: Introduce 100ms delay to deflake tab dragging test DragAll
entry.content:
This commit re-enables the tab dragging interactive_ui_test DragAll.



DragAll is currently disabled for Lacros because it is flaky. It is

flaky because it requests a series of input events which can sometimes

be interpreted as a fling gesture in Ash, if the amount of time that

elapses between touch move and touch release is short enough. Ash avoids

this by directly modifying the fling gesture min velocity, but achieving

the same effect in Lacros would require IPC to set the gesture

configuration in Ash. This API doesn't exist yet. See b/324562919 for

the long-term fix.



Bug: 323898910

entry.content:

the install bin directory. The Rustc toolchain build depends on this

tool, and bootstrap sets the cmake var LLVM_INSTALL_UTILS=ON in order

to use it.

need to.

entry.title: [A11y] Only call PrevOnLine/NextOnLine once per object
entry.content:
At least locally, each function is called 3 times, and the compiler

needs help to optimize things. Save the values in a temporary variable

and reuse them.



Also, at this point, we are serializing, which means the tree is frozen.

It's impossible to have detached objects when the tree is frozen.



Bug: none

entry.title: infra: Add builder() lib args supported in src-internal
entry.content:
Both src and src-internal's copy of infra/config libs have diverged

over time, with some features being added/supported in one and not the

other. To make it easier to share features from src to src-internal,

this copies all builder-args only supported in src-internal to src.



These args aren't used in src, but adding support for them here

makes it much easier to then add features to src-internal since a

simple file copy from src to src-internal will then lead to very few

conflicts/errors.



Note that to reach parity with src-internal:

- xcode configs were moved to their own file

- the "finch" bucket was listed as one that can mirror CI builders



No diff in //infra/config/generated means this is mostly a no-op

from the builder's PoV.



Bug: 324765530

Change-Id: I41ae552bfe253649482a0baeaccf1fec1395afc6
